channel.title: double on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in double on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Why is 0.1 displayed when printed even though 0.1 cannot be represented exactly as a floating point number?
item.description: When ``0.1`` is substituted for ``x`` and displayed on the console, ``0.1`` is displayed. x = 0.1 print(x) # => 0.1 It seems obvious, but 0.1 cannot be represented exactly in floating point numbers (IEEE 754). However, it is strange that print is displayed when doing print. I write down what I learned about this. #Environment This article uses Python 3.7. [Assumption] Floating point number Throughout this article, the term “floating point number” refers to “IEEE 754 double precision”.
